meanings.definition: To set a price higher than (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: The store tried to outpricing its rival by charging more for the same product.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to outpricing their competitors to increase their profit margins.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky squirrel outpriced the other animals by demanding more acorns for his services.
meanings.sent4: The sun outpriced the moon in the sky, shining brighter and stealing the spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The queen bee outpriced her subjects, demanding the sweetest nectar for herself.

meanings.sent1: The bakery outpricing its cakes made them seem more luxurious than the ones at the market.
meanings.sent2: In order to stand out, the boutique decided to outpricing their unique handmade items.
meanings.sent3: The magician outpriced his fellow performers by charging a fortune for his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The artist's masterpiece outpriced all other paintings in the gallery, drawing in wealthy buyers.
meanings.sent5: The rare gemstone outpriced all others at the auction, fetching a record-breaking price.
